trans-unit.source: An element that allows you to host a Windows Forms control on a WPF page.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> element to place a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control within your [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] element or page.

To host a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] element in a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control or form, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.ElementHost> control.
WindowsFormsIntegration.dll is installed with the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] assemblies.
The default location for the assembly is %programfiles%\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\v3.0\WindowsFormsIntegration.dll.

To host a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control in a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] element, you must assign the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child%2A> property.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.PropertyMap%2A> property to assign custom mappings between a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> element and its hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Object Element Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> class.
When implemented in a derived class, positions child elements and determines a size for a <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement"></xref>-derived class.
The final area within the parent that this element should use to arrange itself and its children.
The actual size used.
Gets or sets the hosted control's background as an ambient property.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.BackgroundProperty> field.

By default, this property is mapped to update the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackgroundImage%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties of the hosted control.

For more information on mapping the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Background%2A> property, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*Brush*
See <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brush> for XAML Attribute syntax.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender%2A>
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> set to the background color.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Background"></xref> dependency property.

Overrides the base class implementation of <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndHost.BuildWindowCore(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)"></xref> to build the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
The parent window's handle (HWND).
The window handle for this object.
Gets or sets the child control hosted by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> element.
Only one child control can be hosted, but <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child%2A> can have any number of children.
The child control cannot be a top-level form.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child%2A> is a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>, the form's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.ControlBox%2A> property is set to `false`.
XAML Text Usage
`<` *object* `>`
`<` *hostedControl* `.../>`
`</` *object* `>`
XAML Values
*object*
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> element (or a possible subclass).
*hostedControl*
An element that specifies the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.

Specifying the custom control in markup usually requires an xmlns mapping, see [XAML Namespaces and Namespace Mapping for WPF XAML](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/xaml-namespaces-and-namespace-mapping-for-wpf-xaml.md).
The hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
An attempt was made to assign a top-level form as the hosted control.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child"></xref> property is set.
XAML Attribute Usage
Overrides <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndHost.DestroyWindowCore(System.Runtime.InteropServices.HandleRef)"></xref> to delete the window containing this object.
A window handle.
This parameter is not used.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref>, and optionally releases the managed resources.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Dispose%2A> method disposes the base <xref:System.Windows.Interop.HwndHost> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child%2A> control.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Enables a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Form"></xref> to function correctly when it is opened modelessly from [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)].

Call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.EnableWindowsFormsInterop%2A> method to forward all keyboard messages when a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form?displayProperty=fullName> is opened modelessly.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.EnableWindowsFormsInterop%2A> method installs a message filter that is required for modeless forms to function correctly when opened by [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)].
You need to call this method only once for a particular <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> instance.
Gets or sets the hosted control's font family.
This property setting affects only those controls whose template uses the property as a parameter.
It has no effect on other controls.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontFamilyProperty> field.
By default, this property is mapped to update the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the hosted control.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*fontFamily*
See <xref:System.Windows.Media.FontFamily> for XAML Attribute syntax.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
The font family used in the hosted control.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontFamily"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the hosted control's font size.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontSizeProperty> field.
By default, this property is mapped to update the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the hosted control.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*double*
String representation of a <xref:System.Double> value equal to or greater than 0.0, but smaller than <xref:System.Double.PositiveInfinity>.
This is interpreted as a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_dipixel](~/includes/tlasharptla-dipixel-md.md)] measurement.
Strings need not explicitly include decimal points.
For instance a value of 1 is acceptable.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
The font size used in the hosted control.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontSize"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the hosted control's font style.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontStyleProperty> field.
By default, this property is mapped to update the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the hosted control.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*fontStyle*
See <xref:System.Windows.FontStyle> for XAML Attribute syntax.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
The font style used in the hosted control.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontStyle"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the hosted control's font weight.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontWeightProperty> field.
By default, this property is mapped to update the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the hosted control.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*fontWeight*
See <xref:System.Windows.FontWeight> for XAML Attribute syntax.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsMeasure%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.Inherits%2A>
The font weight used in the hosted control.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.FontWeight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the hosted control's foreground color.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.ForegroundProperty> field.
By default, this property is mapped to update the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the hosted control.

For more information on mapping the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Foreground%2A> property, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*Brush*
See <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brush> for XAML Attribute syntax.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.AffectsRender%2A>,
<xref:System.Windows.FrameworkPropertyMetadata.SubPropertiesDoNotAffectRender%2A>,
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Brush"></xref> used to set the foreground color for the hosted control.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Foreground"></xref> dependency property.
Occurs when a layout error, such as a skew or rotation that <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> does not support, is encountered.
XAML Attribute Usage

Overrides the base class implementation of <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndHost.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)"></xref> to measure the size of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> object and return proper sizes to the layout engine.
Size constraints in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] layout are hard constraints.
If the constraints are exceeded, the host must clip the content within the hosted region.
The implementation of this method enforces this behavior.
The available size for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> object.
The desired size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> object.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.WindowsFormsHostAutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.WindowsFormsHostAutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> element.
Forces the translation of a mapped property.

Calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.OnPropertyChanged%2A> method may be necessary when a property of an ancestor element has changed, but the local value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> element has not changed.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).
Arguments that identify the property that changed as well as providing that property's old and new values.
Specifies the size of the desired padding within the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
XAML Attribute Usage
XAML Values
*Thickness*
See <xref:System.Windows.Thickness> for XAML Attribute syntax.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
A <xref href="System.Windows.Thickness"></xref> structure representing the padding pf the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Padding"></xref> dependency property.

Gets the property map that determines how setting properties on the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> element affects the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] technologies have two similar but different property models.
*Property mapping* supports interoperation between the two architectures.
For more information, see [Windows Forms and WPF Property Mapping](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/windows-forms-and-wpf-property-mapping.md).

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.PropertyMap"></xref> that maps <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost"></xref> properties to properties on the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
Scales the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control, and tracks the scale factor.

[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winforms](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winforms-md.md)] controls do not support scaling in the same way as [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] elements.

For example, scaling a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winforms](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winforms-md.md)] control from a factor of 1 to a factor of 0.5 and back to a factor of 1 does not, in general, recover the original size of the control.
For more information, see [Layout Considerations for the WindowsFormsHost Element](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/layout-considerations-for-the-windowsformshost-element.md).

Override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.ScaleChild%2A> method to provide custom scaling behavior for the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winforms](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
The new scale factor.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Vector"></xref> which represents the scale factor applied to the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.
Gets or sets the hosted control's tab index.
This dependency property is identified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.TabIndexProperty> field.
Use this property to change the order of tab navigation among the controls on a form.
A control with a lower tab index will get focus before a control with a higher index.
XAML Attribute Usage
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The tab index for tab navigation and focus.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.TabIndex"></xref> dependency property.
Forwards focus from [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] to the hosted [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winforms](~/includes/tlasharptla-winforms-md.md)] control.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost> element receives a TAB command from the <xref:System.Windows.Interop.IKeyboardInputSink.TabInto%2A> method, the first eligible control in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Integration.WindowsFormsHost.Child%2A> receives focus.
The first control is specified by the `request` parameter.
When `request` is <xref:System.Windows.Input.FocusNavigationDirection.Next>, the behavior is similar to pressing the TAB key.
When `request` is <xref:System.Windows.Input.FocusNavigationDirection.Previous>, the behavior is similar to pressing SHIFT+TAB.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Input.TraversalRequest"></xref> that specifies the focus behavior.
`true` if a control was activated; otherwise, `false`.
When implemented in a derived class, accesses the window process of the hosted child window.
Window handle of the hosted window.
Message to act upon.
Information that may be relevant to handling the message.
This is typically used to store small pieces of information, such as flags.
Information that may be relevant to handling the message.
This is typically used to reference an object.
Whether events resulting should be marked handled.
The window handle of the child window.
